meanings.definition: Lack of moderation or restraint, especially in regards to alcohol or food.
meanings.sent1: His intemperance in eating led to health problems.
meanings.sent2: Her intemperance with alcohol caused concern among her friends.
meanings.sent3: The intemperance of the squirrel in gathering nuts was comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: The intemperance of the storm in its fury was like a wild beast unleashed.
meanings.sent5: The intemperance of the child's laughter filled the room with joy.

meanings.sent1: The intemperance of his desires led him down a dangerous path.
meanings.sent2: She indulged in intemperance, seeking pleasure at any cost.
meanings.sent3: The intemperance of the cat in sunbathing all day was amusing to the family.
meanings.sent4: The intemperance of the waves crashing against the shore was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The intemperance of the flowers in their bloom filled the garden with color.

meanings.sent1: His intemperance in anger often led to regrettable actions.
meanings.sent2: She struggled with intemperance in managing her emotions.
meanings.sent3: The intemperance of the puppy in chasing its tail was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The intemperance of the wind in its howling echoed through the night.
meanings.sent5: The intemperance of the clock's ticking seemed to mock his impatience.
